snomtools.calcs.materials package¶

Submodules¶

snomtools.calcs.materials.dielectrics module¶

class snomtools.calcs.materials.dielectrics.Dielectric(name, epsilon=1.0, n=1.0)[source]¶

The base class for dielectric materials.

__init__(name, epsilon=1.0, n=1.0)[source]¶

The constructor. Can be initialized with an epsilon or an n value. If you give neither, you’ll end up with Vacuum. All values can be complex.

Parameters:
  • name – The name of the material. E.g. ITO
  • epsilon – The relative dielectric constant of the medium.
  • n – The refraction index,
Returns:

nothing
__module__ = 'snomtools.calcs.materials.dielectrics'¶
epsilon(omega=0)[source]¶

The dielectric constant of the medium.

Parameters:omega – just for compatibility with the metal function, and for determining the output type.
Returns:the dielectric function. will be the same type as omega
n(omega=0.0)[source]¶

The complex refraction index of the medium.

Parameters:omega – just for compatibility with the metal function, and for determining the output type.
Returns:the refraction index. will be the same type as omega

Au by Olmon et al. There are three different datasets: - evaporated (EV) - single cristalline (SC) - template stripped (TS) Datafiles are formatted: Photon energy/eV Wavelength/m ep1 ep2 n k @Article{Olmon2012,

snomtools.calcs.materials.metals module¶

class snomtools.calcs.materials.metals.InterbandTransition(plasma_freq, damping_freq, central_freq)[source]¶

This is the base class for an interband transition. It consists of the parameters for the transition and a method for calculating the effect on the dielectric function.

__init__(plasma_freq, damping_freq, central_freq)[source]¶

The constructor. All frequencies should be given as angular frequencies (rad/s)

Parameters:
  • plasma_freq – the (quasi-)plasma frequency of the bound electrons
  • damping_freq – the damping frequency of the bound electrons
  • central_freq – the central frequency of the interband transition
__module__ = 'snomtools.calcs.materials.metals'¶
epsilon(omega)[source]¶

This method calculates the contribution of the interband transition to the complex dielectric function. Caution: The offset 1 from the vacuum is NOT included, to make it possible to just add all contributions to get the final dielectric function. The formula is: omega_p^2 / (omega_0^2 - omega^2 - i omega gamma)

Parameters:omega – the frequency at which the dielectric function shall be calculated in rad/s
Returns:the contribution to the dielectric function (dimensionless)
class snomtools.calcs.materials.metals.Metal(name, plasma_freq, damping_freq, interband_transitions=None)[source]¶

This is the base class for a metal. A metal is characterized for now, as something with a plasma frequency and one or more interband transitions. This might be extended later on.

__init__(name, plasma_freq, damping_freq, interband_transitions=None)[source]¶

The constructor.

Parameters:
  • name – A string for the name of the material. e.g. “Au”
  • plasma_freq – the plasma frequency of the free electrons in (rad/s)
  • damping_freq – the damping frequency of the free electrons in (rad/s)
  • interband_transitions – a list of interband transitions, given either as instance of the InterbandTransition class or as list or tuple of 3 elements containing the frequencies to initialize one.
Returns:

nothing
__module__ = 'snomtools.calcs.materials.metals'¶
__str__()[source]¶
epsilon(omega)[source]¶

This method calculates the complex dielectric function of the metal. It therefore adds all contributions of the free electrons and the interband transitions.

Parameters:omega – the frequency at which the dielectric function shall be calculated (float or numpy array) in rad/s
Returns:the complex dielectric function (dimensionless)
epsilon_plasma(omega)[source]¶

This method calculates the contribution of the free electrons to the complex dielectric function. Caution: The offset 1 from the vacuum is NOT included, to make it possible to just add all contributions to get the final dielectric function. The formula is: - omega_p^2 / (omega^2 + i omega gamma)

Parameters:omega – the frequency at which the dielectric function shall be calculated (float or numpy array) in rad/s

:return:the contribution to the dielectric function (dimensionless)

epsilon_wo_inter(omega)[source]¶

This method calculates the dielectric function without taking interband transitions into account: epsilon = 1 + epsilon_plasma

Parameters:omega – the frequency at which the dielectric function shall be calculated (float or numpy array) in rad/s
Returns:value of the dielectric function w/o interband transitions (dimensionless)
n(omega)[source]¶

Returns the complex refraction index of the metal. Uses the dielectric function to calculate.

Parameters:omega – the frequency at which the refraction index shall be calculated (float or numpy array) in rad/s
Returns:the complex refraction index (dimensionless)

Module contents¶

This package provides tools for calculating the properties of several material types.
